alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 9:29PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Bennington and southern Windham Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 929 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bennington, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bennington, Brattleboro, Townshend, Putney, Wilmington, Readsboro, Newfane, Guilford, Whitingham, Dover, Marlboro, Brookline, Woodford, Jacksonville, Searsburg, South Newfane, Goose City, East Dummerston, Readsboro Falls and Fairview Village. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
